com.igeekinc.util

Class EncryptionKeys

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.igeekinc.util.EncryptionKeys
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class EncryptionKeys
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    EncryptionKeys hold the keys for encrypting/decrypting The encryption scheme uses a combination of RSA and AES. First, the user enters a pass phrase that will be used for decryption. We generate an RSA key and encrypt the private key using AES with the pass phrase as the key. Each file is encrypted with a random AES key and that key is encrypted using the RSA public key. When we decrypt, the user enters the pass phrase and the RSA private key is decrypted and used to decrypt each file's AES key which is then used to decrypt the actual file. This allows us to encrypt files without having the pass phrase.
    Author:
    David L. Smith-Uchida
    See Also:
